ai.question: Refer to the graphic. What two types of devices are the printer and the IP phone? (Choose two.)

choice.text: The IP phone is a peripheral.
The IP phone is a host.
The IP phone is a network device.
The printer is a network device.

ai.question: What term is used to describe the process of placing one message format into another format in order to deliver the message across the appropriate medium?
What does the 100 mean when referencing the 100BASE-T Ethernet standard?
What is the purpose of a logical address in an IP network?

choice.text: They identify a specific NIC on a host device.
They are used to determine which host device accepts the frame.
They provide vendor-specific information about the host.
They are used to determine if traffic is local or remote.
They are used by switches to make forwarding decisions.

ai.question: Which device accepts a message on one port and always forwards the message out all other ports?
A switch receives a frame with a MAC address that is currently not in the MAC table. What action will the switch perform?

choice.text: It will send out an ARP request looking for the MAC address.
It will flood the frame out all active ports.
It will return the frame to the sender.

ai.question: What information within a data packet does a router use to make forwarding decisions?
If the default gateway is configured incorrectly on the host, what is the impact on communications?

choice.text: The host is unable to communicate on the local network.
The host can communicate with other hosts on the local network, but is unable to communicate with hosts on remote networks.
The host can communicate with other hosts on remote networks, but is unable to communicate with hosts on the local network.
There is no impact on communications.

ai.question: Which two statements accurately describe a router ARP table and routing table? (Choose two.)

choice.text: The ARP table contains information about individual devices, not networks.
The ARP table contains information about networks, not individual devices.
The ARP table contains information about networks and individual devices.
The routing table contains information about individual devices, not networks.
The routing table contains information about networks, not individual devices.
The routing table contains information about networks and individual devices.

ai.question: When using Windows XP, which command shows information about the computer including IP address, subnet mask, default gateway, and additional details about DHCP and DNS?

ai.question: What process can a user perform on the host so that a folder on a remote server is treated as if it were a local resource?
